description:
'''Jeffery Lamar Williams II''' (born August 16, 1991), known professionally as '''Young Thug''',{{efn|(retroactively rendered as a [[backronym]] for ''Truly Humble(d) Under God'')}} is an American rapper. Known for his eccentric vocal style and fashion, he is considered an influential figure in modern [[hip hop music|hip hop]] and [[trap music]], and a pioneer of the [[mumble rap]] microgenre. Williams embarked on a musical career in 2011, releasing a series of [[mixtape]]s beginning with ''I Came from Nothing''. In 2013, he signed with fellow Atlanta rapper Gucci Mane's [[1017 Records]] and gained further attention and praise for his debut mixtape with the label, ''1017 Thug'', released in February of that year.

Williams first received mainstream recognition in 2014 for his singles "[[Stoner (song)|Stoner]]" and "Danny Glover", in addition to his guest appearances on numerous singles, including T.I.'s "[[About the Money]]", Tyga's "[[Hookah (Tyga song)|Hookah]]", and Rich Gang's "[[Lifestyle (Rich Gang song)|Lifestyle]]". That same year, he released a mixtape with Rich Gang titled ''[[Rich Gang: Tha Tour Pt. 1]]'', and signed a solo recording contract with [[300 Entertainment]], an imprint of [[Atlantic Records]]. In 2015, he amassed a number of mixtapes to critical acclaim, releasing ''[[Barter 6]]'' and two installments of his ''[[Slime Season]]'' series. Throughout 2016, Williams saw continued success with the release of his commercial mixtapes ''[[I'm Up (Young Thug mixtape)|I'm Up]]'', ''[[Slime Season 3]]'', and ''[[Jeffery (mixtape)|Jeffery]]''. In 2017, Williams guest performed on the worldwide hit "[[Havana (Camila Cabello song)|Havana]]" by singer [[Camila Cabello]], which became his first number-one single on the [[Billboard Hot 100|''Billboard'' Hot 100]]. The following year, he won the [[Grammy Award for Song of the Year]] for his contributions to Childish Gambino's "[[This Is America (song)|This Is America]]".

Williams' debut studio album ''[[So Much Fun]]'' (2019) peaked atop the US [[Billboard 200|''Billboard'' 200]] and yielded the ''Billboard'' Hot 100 top-20 singles "[[The London (song)|The London]]" (featuring [[J. Cole]] and [[Travis Scott]]) and "[[Hot (Young Thug song)|Hot]]" (featuring [[Gunna (rapper)|Gunna]]). The following year, his single "[[Go Crazy (Chris Brown and Young Thug song)|Go Crazy]]"—with [[Chris Brown]], from their collaborative mixtape ''[[Slime & B]]'' (2020)—peaked at number three on the chart and became his first top-ten single as a lead artist. That same year, he peaked the chart once more for his guest appearance alongside [[M.I.A. (rapper)|M.I.A.]] on Travis Scott's single "[[Franchise (song)|Franchise]]". In 2021, he did so for a third time with his guest appearance alongside [[Future (rapper)|Future]] on Drake's "[[Way 2 Sexy]]". His second studio album ''[[Punk (Young Thug album)|Punk]]'' was released in October of that year to continued success, followed by his third studio album, ''[[Business Is Business (Young Thug album)|Business Is Business]]'', in 2023. In addition to his solo career, he has released two compilation albums with his record label [[YSL Records]]: ''[[Slime Language]]'' (2018) and ''[[Slime Language 2]]'' (2021) to resultant success; the latter debuted atop the ''Billboard'' 200. In 2025, he announced his fourth and comeback album ''[[UY Scuti (Young Thug album)|UY Scuti]]'', following his [[RICO act|RICO acts]] charges from 2022 to 2024.

Williams was arrested in May 2022 alongside 27 members of [[YSL Records|YSL]] and was charged with 63 counts of illegal substance trafficking or firearm possession and for violating the [[Georgia RICO (Racketeer Influenced and Corrupt Organizations) Act|Georgia RICO Act]]. He was held without bail in the [[Fulton County Jail]] on [[Pre-trial detention|remand]] and his trial began in November 2023. Williams was released in October 2024 after accepting a [[Plea bargain|deal]] which saw him plead [[no contest]] to several charges; it resulted in him being sentenced to time served and 15 years of probation.
